column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Like raging wolves...
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Perhaps their bloodlust has been sated now.
column3: Espérons que leur soif de sang est assouvie, pour le moment.
column4: Vielleicht ist ihre Gier nach Blut jetzt gestillt.
column6: Puede que su sed de sangre haya quedado satisfecha.

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
They must be stopped!
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Barbarians!
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
There seems to be no reprieve from these accursed Norse.
column3: Ces maudits nordiques n'accordent aucun répit à leurs victimes.
column4: Es scheint, wir werden keine Ruhe vor diesen verfluchten Normannen haben.
column6: Parece que no hay respiro posible con estos malditos nórdicos

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
May they suffer a thousand deaths for their crimes!
column3: Que ces monstres souffrent au centuple de ce qu'ils ont pu infliger !
column4: Mögen sie für ihr Verbrechen unzählige Male sterben!
column6: ¡Que sufran mil muertes por sus crímenes!

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Is this the end of days?
column6: ¿Es este el fin de los días?

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Surely that can't be true!
The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
May they suffer an eternity of pain!
column3: Qu'ils souffrent dans une éternité de douleur !

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Is there no place beyond their reach?
column3: Aucune ville n'est donc à l'abri de la menace mongole ?
column4: Gibt es überhaupt noch Länder, die sie nicht erreichen können?
column6: ¿No queda lugar fuera de su alcance?

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Such butchery will not go unpunished.
column3: Un tel massacre ne restera pas impuni !
column4: Solch ein Gemetzel bleibt nicht ungestraft.

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
Have they no regard for culture?
column3: N'ont-ils donc aucun respect pour les civilisations ?
column4: Haben sie keine Respekt für Kultur?
column6: ¿Es que no sienten respeto por la cultura?

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
There will come a time of reckoning.
column3: Viendra le temps des règlements de comptes.
column4: Die Zeit der Abrechnung wird kommen.

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
May it be the last city the Norse take!
column3: Espérons que cette ville sera la dernière prise des nordiques !
column4: So möge es die letzte Stadt sein, die die Normannen nehmen!
column6: ¡Que sea la última ciudad que toman los nórdicos!

column2: The Norse sack [From.GetName]!
The Norse scourge has poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the holy city! It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
This time they have gone too far!
column4: Diesmal sind sie zu weit gegangen!

column2: The Fall of [From.GetName]

Brave Norse warriors have poured through the Gates of [From.GetName] and sacked the once proud holy city. It has been left a smoldering ruin and the streets now run red with the blood of its former inhabitants.
They shall never forget our might.
column4: Sie werden unsere Macht niemals vergessen.
